definitions.definition: in every way that is important; completely

examples.text: The two approaches are fundamentally different.
By the 1960s the situation had changed fundamentally.
They remained fundamentally opposed to the plan.

definitions.definition: used when you are introducing a topic and stating something important about it

examples.text: Fundamentally, there are two different approaches to the problem.

definitions.definition: used when you are saying what is the most important thing about somebody/something

examples.text: She is fundamentally a nice person, but she finds it difficult to communicate.
